title: Boy, six, out of intensive care after 'being thrown' from 10th floor of Tate Modern
text:
A six-year-old boy seriously injured after allegedly being thrown from the viewing platform of the Tate Modern art gallery has been moved out of intensive care, his family said.

The French child, who cannot be named because of his age, is now in a rehabilitation centre and looks like "a little knight" with splints keeping many of his limbs in place as he recovers from the ordeal.

In a post on the GoFundMe page, which has raised more than £107,000 for his care, the injured boy's family said he was making progress but had not yet been able to speak.

They said: "He is now in a rehabilitation centre. He still has some metal in his body but instead of plasters he has got a full armour of splints: legs, feet, hands, arms, neck and torso.

"It is impressive - he looks like a little knight, and we can take these splints off sometimes.
description: A six-year-old boy seriously injured after allegedly being thrown from the viewing platform of the Tate Modern art gallery has been moved out of intensive care, his family said.
